## Bio 🙋🏻‍♀️

Sita Lujintanon is an epidemiologic-implementation researcher. Her works aims to improve equity in HIV care engagement in Thailand, where she is from, and globally.

She has experience in coordinating HIV treatment programs, applying implementation science frameworks to grant writing and study protocol development, and conducting systematic review to synthesize new implementation science knowledge.

She has a growing interest in overcoming missing data problems, particularly related to missing outcomes due to loss to follow-up and competing event, for improved HIV cascade outcome assessment, and using observational-implementation research approach for rapid knowledge translation.

During her free time, Sita enjoys windsurfing, scuba diving, hiking, and visiting Thailand to spend time with her family and her dog, Sam 🐶.
